Metro

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • Metro.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    The Network is an object designed to represent a subway network, it contains some objects to help it. graph : It's jwetherell's implementation of a graph, a clean directed graph which can be used with the Astar algorithm. Astar : It's jwetherell's implementation of the Astar algorithm to search through the whole graph to find the fastest path. linesWithIncidents : regroup every lines with incidents of the graph. As the lines are no longer represented by their own object but rather by graph's edges it's the only direct way to stock them. Lines : represents every "great line" of the network (a great line is the type of line where you don't have to get out of the subway at the station to go on another one).
    Author:
    Nicolas

      • addStation

        public boolean addStation(Metro.Station s)
        Add a selected station to the network
        Parameters:
        s - The station we want to add (can't be null)
        Returns:
        - True if the station have been successfully added - False otherwise

      • addLine

        Add a Line in the network between two station By default there is no incident on it
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createLine

        public boolean createLine(Metro.Station s1,
                          Metro.Station s2,
                          java.time.Duration duration)
        Create a custom Line between two stations of the network, the line must not be in the network As it is an undirected graph, we can switch the values of s1 and s2
        Parameters:
        s1 - The first station
        s2 - The second station
        duration - The duration required to travel between the two stations can't be negative
        Returns:
        - True if the station has been successfully added to the network - False otherwise

      • createStation

        public boolean createStation(float latitude,
                             float longitude,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             java.time.Duration waitingTime)
        Create and insert a station from the given arguments to the graph
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude of the station
        longitude - The longitude of the station
        name - The name of the station (two stations with the same name are considered the same)
        waitingTime - The time required to leave the station
        Returns:
        - True is the Station has been successfully created and added to the graph - False otherwise

      • aStar

        public java.util.List<jwetherell.Graph.Edge<Metro.Station>> aStar(jwetherell.Graph<Metro.Station> graph,
                                                                  jwetherell.Graph.Vertex<Metro.Station> start,
                                                                  jwetherell.Graph.Vertex<Metro.Station> goal)
        Uses the A* algorithm to find the fastest way from one point to another in the graph
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph or subgraph we want to use for the algorithm
        start - The starting station of the Graph
        goal - The station where we want to go
        Returns:
        An ordered list of the edges that connects our start and our goal

      • multipleBreakPoints

        public java.util.List<jwetherell.Graph.Edge<Metro.Station>> multipleBreakPoints(jwetherell.Graph<Metro.Station> graph,
                                                                                java.util.List<jwetherell.Graph.Vertex<Metro.Station>> list)
        This function finds the fastest way to go from the starting point to the goal through an ordered list of vertices.
        Parameters:
        graph - The whole graph, usually it will be the this object but another graph can also be used
        list - This is the list of vertices you want to pass by in your travel, there are some restrictions on it. - It must Contain at least two vertices - The first vertex must be your starting point - The last vertex must be your goal
        Returns:
        A list of Edges that links every points of the list.

      • buildSubGraph

        public jwetherell.Graph<Metro.Station> buildSubGraph(jwetherell.Graph<Metro.Station> g)
        Builds a sub graph containing only Stations without incidents and lines (Edges) without incidents
        Parameters:
        g - The main graph from where we want to extract the valid Stations and Lines
        Returns:
        A subgraph that contains only Stations and Lines without incidents

        public jwetherell.Graph.Vertex<Metro.Station> findNearestStation(java.lang.Float latitude,
                                                                 java.lang.Float longitude)
        This methods runs through every Station of the graph and returns the nearest one to the given parameters
        Parameters:
        latitude - A gps coordinate, the latitude must be between -90 and 90 included
        longitude - A gps coordinate, the longitude must be between -90 and 90 included
        Returns:
        The nearest Station coordinates wise
